html:
LONDON, May 25 (Reuters) - British industrial software company Aveva AVV.L said the business environment had improved in most of its major markets following disruption caused by COVID-19 in the first half of its last financial year, giving it confidence about the year ahead.

The company, which completed the acquisition of OSIsoft just before its year-end, on Tuesday met expectations by reporting revenue of 820.4 million pounds ($1.16 billion), down 1.6%, and adjusted earnings of 226.4 million pounds, up 4.4%, for the year to end-March.



($1 = 0.7055 pounds)


(Reporting by Paul Sandle; Editing by Kate Holton)

(( paul.sandle@thomsonreuters.com ; +44 20 7542 6843; Reuters Messaging: paul.sandle.thomsonreuters.com@reuters.net ))

Keywords: AVEVA-RESULTS/ (URGENT)
